question: In which year, the Icelandic constitutional referendum was held in which voters were asked whether the Union with Denmark should be abolished and whether to adopt a new republican constitution?
explanation: In the year 1944, the Icelandic constitutional referendum was held in which voters were asked whether the Union with Denmark should be abolished and whether to adopt a new republican constitution. A two-part referendum was held in Iceland between 20 and 23 May 1944. Voters were asked whether the Union with Denmark should be abolished and whether to adopt a new republican constitution.
